Learn More About Los Angeles, California & What It Means

Los Angeles is a city located in Southern California about 15 miles from the coast.

What does Los Angeles mean?

Los Angeles in spanish translates to "The Angeles"

Los Angeles got it's name from Spanish Explorers who's entire name is actually El Pueblo de Nuestra Señora la Reina de los Ángeles del Río Porciúncula", which translates to "The Town of Our Lady the Queen of the Angels of the River Porciúncula.

Who Where The Earliest People To Inhabit The Los Angeles, California Area?

The first humans that stepped foot on the land that is now Los Angeles are known as The Tongva's. The Tongva, are a Native American people who's living area spanned the LA Basin which covers multiple counties including Los Angeles, San Bernadino, and all of Orange County. Using canoes called "ti’at" The Tongva people have periodically lived on the islands located off the coast of the basin. These islands include Santa Catalina, Santa Cruz, and San Clemente which is really impressive when you consider that this little cluster of islands is about 20 to 25 miles from the coast.
